snippet: More people sought unemployment aid last week, but the average for the past month fell, a sign that fewer employers are cutting jobs.
abstract: Labor Department reports applications for unemployment insurance rose 5,000 to seasonally adjusted 274,000 in latest week; four-week average of applications drops to 266,250, lowest since April 2000.
lead_paragraph: More people sought unemployment aid last week, but the average for the past month fell, a sign that fewer employers are cutting jobs.

headline.main: Jobless Benefits Applications Fall to a 15-Year Low
headline.print_headline: Jobless Benefits Applications Fall to a 15-Year Low
